titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William F. White, Judgment
CWG5051

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky, Fayette Circuit Court,
June Term 1864, June 13th 1864.
The Comth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } On Indictment
William F White & John Payne Defendants

The Commonwealth came by the attorney, and the Defendant Payne appeared, and by agreement of parties, and with leave of the Court, It is adjudged that the Plaintiff recover of the said John Payne, the sum of Five hundred dollars and also her costs herein expended.

A Copy Att Jno B Norton c f c c
By Chas F Lowry D C

Fayette Cir Ct
Comth of Kentucky
vs } Copy Judgt
Payne JohnRemit except fees & costs
Thos E Bramlette
27th June/64For Deft Payne.
